Creamy Mushroom Lasagna

By Jesse Szewczyk
October 9, 2023

4.7

(12)

    Photo by Elizabeth Coetzee, Food Styling by Rebecca Jurkevich

        A good mushroom lasagna recipe can be the highlight of a simple dinner or a special-occasion feast: itâs easy enough for a cozy family meal but celebratory enough for a festive dinner party. This version keeps things relatively simple so the mushrooms can truly shine. Instead of any tomato-based sauce, a luxurious cream sauce, bolstered with thyme, garlic, and a touch of lemon zest, holds together tender lasagna sheets and savory, meaty mushrooms here. This recipe calls for crimini, but just about any type of mushroom can be used in their place with equally delicious results. Button, shiitake, and portobellos would all be welcomed; just make sure to stick to the given weight measurement (2 lb.) and slice them thinly so they shingle nicely with the noodles. Alternating layers of creamy ricotta punctuated with salty Parmesan provide a contrasting texture, and a final layer of mozzarella is broiled for a deeply burnished finish. To get ahead, you can assemble the lasagna, wrap the pan in plastic wrap, and store it in the fridge until ready to bake.

        All products featured on Epicurious are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

        What youâll need

        • 9-by-13 Baking Dish

          $36 $30 At Amazon

        • 5.5 Quart Dutch Oven

          $420 At Amazon

        • Colander

        Recipe information

        • Total Time

          1 hour 50 minutes

        • Yield

          6â8 servings

        Ingredients

        1 lb. dried lasagna
        3Â½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or 2 tsp. Morton kosher salt, divided, plus more
        16 Tbsp. (2 sticks) unsalted butter, divided
        2 lb. crimini mushrooms, trimmed, thinly sliced
        1Â½ tsp. freshly ground pepper, divided, plus more
        3 shallots, finely chopped
        8 garlic cloves, finely chopped
        2 Tbsp. finely chopped thyme
        Â½ cup all-purpose flour
        5 cups whole milk
        2 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
        2 tsp. finely grated lemon zest
        1 large egg
        6 oz. Parmesan, finely grated (about 3 cups)
        2 cups whole-milk fresh ricotta
        8 oz. low-moisture mozzarella, coarsely grated (1â cups)

        Preparation

        1. Step 1

          Place a rack in middle of oven; preheat to 375Â°. Cook 1 lb. dried lasagna in a large pot of generously salted water, stirring occasionally, until about 3 minutes shy of al dente (it should be about two thirds of the way cooked and still slightly too hard to eat), about 5 minutes. Drain pasta, rinse under cold running water until cool to the touch, and set aside.

          Step 2

          Meanwhile, melt 6 Tbsp. unsalted butter in a large Dutch oven or other heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add 2 lb. crimini mushrooms, trimmed, thinly sliced, 1 tsp. Diamond Crystal or Â½ tsp. Morton kosher salt, and Â½ tsp. freshly ground pepper. Cook, stirring often, until mushrooms release their moisture, shrink, and brown, 15â20 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl; reserve pot.

          Step 3

          Melt remaining 10 Tbsp. unsalted butter in reserved pot over medium heat. Cook 3 shallots, finely chopped, 8 garlic cloves, finely chopped, and 2 Tbsp. finely chopped thyme and cook, stirring often, until shallots are softened to an almost paste-like texture and mixture is fragrant, 7â10 minutes. Add Â½ cup all-purpose flour, 2Â½ tsp. Diamond Crystal or 1Â½ tsp. Morton kosher salt, and 1 tsp. freshly ground pepper and cook, stirring constantly, until onions are evenly coated in flour and no dry pockets remain, 1â2 minutes. Gradually pour in 5 cups whole milk, whisking constantly, and bring to a simmer. Cook, whisking constantly, just until thick enough to coat a spoon, 1â2 minutes. Stir in 2 Tbsp. Dijon mustard and 2 tsp. finely grated lemon zest. Taste sauce and season with more salt and pepper if needed.

          Step 4

          Combine 1 large egg, 6 oz. Parmesan, finely grated (about 3 cups), and 2 cups whole-milk fresh ricotta in a medium bowl; season cheese mixture with salt and pepper. Spread about Â¾ cup sauce across the bottom of a 13x9" glass or ceramic baking dish. Top with an even layer of noodles (about 3Â½). Cut in half lengthwise as needed to puzzle in tightly. (If noodles are sticking together, rinse under cool running water to help unstick.) Spread a heaping â cup cheese mixture over noodles, scatter a heaping â cup mushrooms evenly on top, and dollop a heaping â cup sauce on top. Starting with noodles, repeat layers, using more or less of various components depending on how quickly you deplete them. Spread final sauce layer (about Â½ cup) thinly and evenly over mushrooms, then sprinkle 8 oz. low-moisture mozzarella, coarsely grated (1â cups) evenly on top.

          Step 5

          Bake lasagna until edges are golden brown and bubbling, 40â50 minutes. If youâd like additional color on top, heat broiler and broil just until center is browned (keep a close eye on lasagna to prevent burning), 1â3 minutes, depending on your broiler. Let lasagna sit 15 minutes before serving.

          Do Ahead: Lasagna can be assembled 1 day ahead. Cover and chill. Baking time will be 5â10 minutes longer.
